Reviews.Title: Simple, easy to use phone
Reviews.Author: Diana
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone as a gift for my grandma. She was in dire need of another one and I did my research to find a nice, easy to use phone for her, considering that she was elderly. The phone has a textured surface, but when flipped, has very big buttons for calling. Perfect for her! I programmed it all for her and it works well - clear voice calling, but we did not test out text messaging, since she has no use for that. Overall, it's a very nice looking phone for the older generation and she was completely satisfied with it. Therefore, I am as well!

Reviews.Title: I really like my new flip phone Samsung GT-C3520
Reviews.Author: MrT
Reviews.Content: I used to be in the high tech industry for years but never got crazy about smartphones.  All in all, I like the Samsung GT-C3520 for its simplicity and good quality calls.  I want a reliable phone (no butt call) that I can carry around in my daily (and often messy) activities where dropping the phone happens too often and where the phone gets in contact with metal (nails/screws) and dirt in my pockets. When my friends join me, they often end up leaving their smartphones in their cars or in my house.  Now no doubt that when we travel, I'm glad that my wife has a smartphone with a GPS and the ability to browse.  However, on a daily basis, the GT-C3520 is all I need.I purchased this phone to replace another flip phone that was slowly failing to charge.  I have a basic pay as you go plan with T-Mobile and after swapping the SIM card, the Samsung GT-C3520 was up and running making calls and sending SMS on the T-Mobile network.A few days later, I flew to France and purchased a new SIM from Orange SFR. The phone being unlocked, I was able to get on the SFR network and get/receive calls/SMS.  I was told that the SIM card would only work in France.  However, on my way back from Europe, I was even able to get a few SMS to the US from the Amsterdam airport (2 hours layover before getting back the US).Back in the US, I'm again using my Samsung with T-Mobile.  I got it to work with my Subaru outback using the Bluetooth capabilities.  It is great to now be able to talk in the car (pretty rare) without holding the phone.  The sound quality is really good.Finally, since I had a 1 GB Micro SD card, I popped it into the GT-C3520.  The card was immediately recognized (as expected).  I now have my favorite music with me for the rare cases when I drive alone.The only thing that I'm missing with this phone is a calculator.  Maybe I did not see it yet or maybe I can download a calculator later.  Something to investigate...

Reviews.Title: Easy to use phone for: Seniors, Children and Tweens--readon for more details...
Reviews.Author: Daisy S "Daisy S"
Reviews.Content: This phone was purchased for a child's first cellphone. This somewhat rugged cellphone is a great find for today, the day of the touchphones! Who in the world would want a easy to use flip phone? Note that the comments you may find helpful and feel free to ask me any questions as I am a techie...1) A young child that wants a first cellphone just to text on, make phone calls, listen to FM Radio or listen to MP3 songs! This phone is so so easy to set up and use. This is for someone who just needs to make phone calls sometimes and does NOT need to get on the Internet (data). It does NOT have WiFi in this phone. But it can be set up with APN settings to use data if you have a data plan with AT&T;, T-Mobile etc.2) Seniors who want a "Phone, Phone" with no bells and whistles that is easy to set up and use! This is a carefree, no fancy stuff type of phone. If you just want the basics in a phone: Flip phone style, MP3 (music player), camera, FM Radio, this is the phone for you.3)People who want the basic type of phone that you can use for PrePaid minutes or GoPhone minutes with ANY GSM provider with no contract such as AT&T;, T-Mobile, Simple Mobile, etc. I would advice one of these as they just need to be added to once a year:Both AT&T; and T-Mobile offer prepaid minutes of 1,000 minutes good for ONE YEAR for just $100 per year--this is just 10 cents per minute for phone calls with NO CONTRACT! As far as costs for text messages, AT&T; charges 20 cents to receive and 25 cents to send (Ouch), these come out of your minutes balance. T-Mobile is cheaper for texts, they just charge 10 cents to receive and I think it is 20 cents to send.When you get the YEARLY PREPAID of just $100 with either AT&T; or T-Mobile, this is the CHEAPEST way to go if you do not need lots of minutes and the cost is LESS THAN $10 per month.Thank you for reading this review, if you have any questions, please ask in the comments and I will be happy to answer all questions...

Reviews.Title: Samsung GT-C3520
Reviews.Author: Glenn P. Lobo "Glennthedude"
Reviews.Content: Bought this to use while travelling overseas. Good quality basic phone, sharp display.Worked in the US with ATT SIM card

Reviews.Title: Great little flip phone
Reviews.Author: DaZoob
Reviews.Content: I am posting this comment because someone had mentioned that they had a problem connecting via bluetooth to a non-samsung device.  I found this to be NOT true.  I was able to connect to three different BT devices without a hitch: My Toyota Avalon, My Motorola HX earpiece and my Plantronics backbeat 903 stereo headset....all work as they should.  If this was your concern in purchasing this phone, let it not be. Read the manual on BT pairing and you'll be fine...All you have to do is turn on BT in the settings menu.This phone is lightweight, relatively slim, and has both Gmail and Google-Chat apps built in. The battery lasts for days.  Only downside: No front display, but you knew that already.

Reviews.Title: OKAY BUT SLOW
Reviews.Author: Reginald Wery
Reviews.Content: I was in the market for a flip phone and purchased it based on the reviews. This cell was a bit of a disappointment as I switched from a smartphone to this. DOWNERS: speakerphone clarity/loudness was poor and especially so if there is some noise at either end: 2) texting is slow and tedious and takes practice i.e., if you press too many times you'll pass the letter and have to start again. 3) the "missed calls" indicator does not remain on the display for long and the only way to retrieve a missed call is to revert to the menu/logs function. UPPERS: If you are not in a rush (sometimes) and have arthritis this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: Good phone for Calls & Text
Reviews.Author: xgnx
Reviews.Content: i wanted a flip phone with large buttons and long battery life.  the phone has large buttons but its too early to judge battery life.so i will update my review in a few months.  battery charger is european but comes with the adapter so you can plug in to outlets here in the USA.  i had to change the language to english. battery charge to full in 90 minutes.  then i  put in my ATT sim card and i was good to go.  texting was simple and easy and worked without having to change settings.  haven't tried MMS but i am sure i will have to create the settings for that. phone call quality was excellent on the one call i made to test it.  phone is not as solid as i thought it would be but and taking off the back panel is a bit of a pain.update: cannot find the correct MMS setting so i cannot send or receive Pictures.  battery life is still really great.  the charge lasts for 7 days at least and often for 10 days.update2- att MMS settings-go to Settings-Network-Connections-Internet profiles(select)-options- new profileprofile name: Cingular MMSthe go to edit-and enter these settings:set Name: Cingular MMSHome url: mmsc.cingular.com(dont forget to put: [...])bearer: GRPS onlyproxy: onaddress: 66.209.11.32port: 8080dns1 & dns2- leave blankGRPS settings:access name: wap.cingularuser id: CINGULARGRPS.COM (ALL CAPS)PASSWORD: CINGULAR1 (ALL CAPS)

Reviews.Title: Awesome phone
Reviews.Author: Manuel Batista
Reviews.Content: Awesome phone, my dad has loved it. Nice replacement for his outdated motorola v3. As it is unlocked, this phone works with Claro and Orange networks in the Dominican Republic. Havent tried it on other networks.

Reviews.Title: Not That Great
Reviews.Author: Debbie
Reviews.Content: I liked it because it had the 3.5 jack, and that it is a flip phone. What I didn't like about the phone is that it don't have a lot of memory. It wouldn't import all the information from the SIM card to the phone.

Reviews.Title: Decent "feature phone" with a couple of shortcomings.
Reviews.Author: Alexander L. Belikoff
Reviews.Content: I got this phone for my father-in-law as a replacement of an old, broken one. Good news first: it works and it is reasonably simple for him to handle and loud enough for him to hear. It also uses micro-USB socket for charging (amazingly, there are still models that use proprietary chargers).The bad: volume control. There is none. You are expected to navigate through the menus to change the volume and it's nowhere near simple.Then there is the price. I mean, in the age of marginally decent sub-$100 Android smartphones (with WiFi et al.), what does a "feature phone" offer to command a price of $70?!Overall, however, if you want a simple (that is, simple in basic features as long as you don't touch the Byzantine UI) yet reliable phone and can live with the price, then this phone is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: Great little phone that makes me want to have a flip phone again!
Reviews.Author: R. Maung
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my parents who travel and live between two countries and since it's so hard to get a hold of them, I thought an unlocked mobile phone with some internet functions will help. This is simple enough for those who don't use technology too much. But it has all these preloaded apps including Facebook and emails, chat, etc.of course, you can browse web too. However, I have yet to try these apps and see how they work as I only purchased a basic international SIM card with no data plan and low credit. I did try calling my own cell phone using this SIM card and the phone worked. The camera is OK. Good for this type of phone but don't expect a smartphone standard because this is not a smartphone. Camera isn't bad at all. I took pictures of my kids and my nephews so my parents can look at their grandchildren while away, and the images turned out great! Menu isn't as intuitive but if you've used a flip phone or old generation cell phones before smartphones came out, you will know how to navigate it easily. It's light, and its body is made of plastic (as most phones are, really...except for a few Motorola phones I've came across) so it does make me wonder about what will happen if it's dropped. But it fits so well in the hand so I doubt it'll fall out. Note, I do have small hands, and so do my parents.I have not used it outside of USA, even when I tested the international SIM card so I don't know how it works outside the country, but if it allows calls from mY international SIM card, it definitely is unlocked, so I'm assuming all other SIM cards from other countries will work as well. It is so cute and user friendly that I wish I can keep it but I got myself another smartphone that's unlocked my own travels, and have an AT&T; GoPhone (which is a flip phone with lesser functions than this phone) and my own regular AT&T; smartphone for use in here at home in USA. I think I definitely have too many phones, so this phone will go to my parents as initially planned.

Reviews.Title: good travel phone
Reviews.Author: H. Takai "chemariachi"
Reviews.Content: Excellent phone! I used it overseas. Got a SIM card, plug it in and it worked. I highly recommend this phone for people who want a simple phone to make phone calls!

Reviews.Title: Phone works ok but has some issues with blue tooth
Reviews.Author: Harry E. Becker "Beach Bum"
Reviews.Content: I paired this phone with my sync system in my Ford fusion. It hooked up imediately and worked. However, every time I start my car the samsung phone sounds an alert and asks if it should connect with sync. So, I have to get my phone out of my pocket and press yes or the phone will not connect.  My old Motorola woud connect automatically when the car was started. I should not have to ok connection every time I start my car. I was also surprised that this was an international version phone because that was not noted on the information when I purchased the phone on Amazon.com

Reviews.Title: Good every day phone
Reviews.Author: S. Garrett
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone specifically for a trip to Europe, but I have started using it as an everyday phone.  We haven't gone overseas yet so I cannot comment on whether it meets those needs, but as it is unlocked, quadband and GSM, it should be just fine.  I like a flip phone and there are not many options anymore.  My previous phone had exterior buttons and I disconnected calls while trying to answer them by bumping those buttons - this one has none of those.  It has no exterior view screen, but it can be set to require a button push to answer, so opening it to see who is calling does not connect the call (screening calls).  I don't need a large selection of features.  I guess this one can do data, but I don't do data on my phone so I can't review that.  I can hear on this phone better than my previous phone which is one of the reasons that I started using it right away.  It is slim and lightweight.  The screen is easy to read and buttons easy to push.  I am not physically hard on a phone so even tho this one doesn't seem to be real "tough" (battery cover is plastic) - it should be okay for me.

Reviews.Title: Nice pocket phone
Reviews.Author: Mike Murphy
Reviews.Content: Nice phone for travel.  It is easy to use and has good sound quality, battery life and texting.  Alarm is reliable.  Since it is an unlocked quad band it is perfect for travel.

Reviews.Title: Phone optimized for European users
Reviews.Author: Ben Leppke
Reviews.Content: The phone arrived on time and in excellent condition. It's an absolutely great phone.The downside is, the two I received are optimized for European customers. The chargers are the large circular prong chargers used in Europe and although they were shipped with adapters as well, it isn't as convenient as I had hoped. You also can only set the date as DD/MM/YYYY or YYYY/MM/DD. There is no option for MM/DD/YYYY for US customers where this format is standard.There is also no data cable included, which is standard with the models I have purchased in the US.Otherwise it's a great price and arrived quickly. But American customers be warned that you are purchasing a European phone.

Reviews.Title: Good simple phone
Reviews.Author: muliehunter
Reviews.Content: The phone works well, battery life is good. It is just a regular phone without all the needless stuff on it

Reviews.Title: samsung phone
Reviews.Author: Terry
Reviews.Content: Good service getting the phone here. I would buy from this seller again. I like the phone took a little getting used to asthings have to go about different ways that Motorola. But excellent phone, will buy samsung again.I would recommend to anyone looking for a good basic phone.

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: new mama
Reviews.Content: I did not want an iphone, so this one was a good find. It is a simple phone, and I like that I can take it abroad. it has all features.

Reviews.Title: good phone-simple setup menu when first started
Reviews.Author: chris
Reviews.Content: when calling the sound was just right but speaker phone is only to be here a short distance away from you.but its load enough to here it clearly when close. came with international plug (Europe) but it had adapter on it already for use here so no biggie. not sure if box is closed when from manufacturer but it couldn't have been cause there was a card in there with 24hour on it(place I bought from). phone doesn't appear used or refurbished (been down that line I know what they look like ) time will tell but ill write back if bad battery life or stuff shows like paint rub off etc(ie a reman) . this line comes with a rayovac battery you can get from batteriesplus .a reg battery store online and some stores in va.

Reviews.Title: My mom loves it!
Reviews.Author: Doc Aga
Reviews.Content: I both this phone for my Mom, she loves it! Its easy to use, bright and easy to read screen. I got it running under T-Mobile. If you want an easy to operate phone, get one of this.

Reviews.Title: great flip phone, unlocked and ready for any GSM carrier
Reviews.Author: S. MA
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my MIL to use with a pay per use plan.  The phone works great, it has more features than a 60 year old could ever use.  She likes the silver color and the touch.  For an elderly, lighter color objects means it's easier to spot.  The phone has a good grip, doesn't feel slippery for dry hands.  The keys are easy to press and very responsive.  I have a different Samsung cell phone I bought a few years back, still works great.  If this brand holds up to its image and reputation, my MIL could enjoy using this phone for at least a few years.This phone does not boot up to any carrier (T-Mobile, AT&T;, etc phones with contracts) ....if this info is important to you...

Reviews.Title: Bluetooth capability
Reviews.Author: Ervin C Brong
Reviews.Content: Item supposedly has bluetooth. No instructions how to set up.Cannot find instructions anywhere.I have looked on line everywhere.Please advise.

Reviews.Title: Preliminary review
Reviews.Author: Cookie's mom
Reviews.Content: This is a preliminary review, we have not used the phone yet but I thought I'd tell what came with it.  We bought this product from seller 24hrsdeals so we could get the free 2-day shipping.  The phone was new, the corner of the box was slightly crushed but all contents were intact, and the writing on the outside of the box was mostly in Spanish.  The phone came with battery, US wall charger, micro USB to USB connecter, and a headset(earbuds), plus instruction booklets in both English and Spanish and a card telling us to contact the seller's website for instructions on how to program it.  I gave it four stars at this time because the seller claims it has a U.S. warranty but there is no warranty information included.  I bought the phone for a family member to use with local SIM cards while traveling in Europe, so I checked the wall charger to make sure it would accept 240V current; it does, so it should charge OK with a simple plug adapter in Europe.  I will try to update this review after we actually see how well it works.

Reviews.Title: Great phone with large keyboard, large display, many language options.
Reviews.Author: cc
Reviews.Content: Not the most advance phone but great for what it was built for - phone calls.it's slippery and a little difficult to flip open - i guess no one will ever build a phone like captain kirk's communicator... but why?????...mfgs are not even building phones anymore...probably because the networks don't want just a phone - guess the revenue stream is not great enough.

Reviews.Title: Awful experience.
Reviews.Author: Elena M.
Reviews.Content: Phone got broken in a month after we bought it. When we tried to contact the seller, we found that It was sold by Global Mobiles without US warranty (not a word about it in the description) and we had to send it to Germany (!) for repair. Seller was rude and unreasonable, not willing to cooperate and help us out at all.  Piece of junk and total disappointment.

Reviews.Title: Good Phone
Reviews.Author: Dal
Reviews.Content: Was impressed by the one I bought for my mother to use and decided to get one for myself, wife thinks I should have gotten a smartphone like her but I only need a dumb phone, one that rings and just a few other things, don't care about games, I am already grown, texting is not for me and internet I can wait till I get home for..

Reviews.Title: Very poor phone
Reviews.Author: Renee
Reviews.Content: The phone wasn't what expected. I bought it as a gift and when it arrived I was embarrass ti give as a gift.  It also took several days longer than was promised to arrive with no update or explanation as to why.

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: Danny Valbuena
Reviews.Content: It's a nice phone, is small and easy to use menu is pretty easy, its Numeron are great for improving writing. The detail is that in the languages ​​you choose eto write the messages does not bring the Spanish and this is not I detail in the publication.

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: harlingford
Reviews.Content: The phone I received is defective- the microphone is somehow attached directly to the case so that the noise of my hand on the case makes a loud sound, louder than my voice. It took me a while to realize the problem since I use the phone infrequently and only when traveling. People told me the call quality was poor and that there was a loud rustling noise but I thought it was just poor reception or from using the phone outside. I finally tested it calling my own landline and realized the problem. Unfortunately, this was after two months, so I could no longer return through Amazon. Global Mobile says I can send it to their German site for repair. I'm looking into what the postage would be and whether it is worth it. Probably not given the other limitations of the phone.  Otherwise, the phone is OK with a couple of drawbacks. The main one is that the boot process takes quite a long time. So if you keep it turned off most of the time, as I do, it takes a while before it is usable - much longer boot than a cheap $20 BLU Jenny phone I have, which overall is as good or better as a phone (though the Jenny lacks an audio jack) . Also, the quality of the photos is really poor indoors. (Not a shock for a fairly cheap phone, but in case this is important to you).  In the end I'll probably be out the $68 I paid. No complaints about the response of Global Mobile, which was rapid, or Amazon. It was my fault for not testing more carefully in the first month when it could have been returned.

Reviews.Title: Great flip phone with some web functionality
Reviews.Author: Big Ed
Reviews.Content: Pros:Excellent sound qualityExcellent ring volumeExcellent mid size displayVery compact and pocket friendlyIncredible battery life, particularly on standbyAdequate camera and camcorderBuilt in email, Google, and a variety of social media appsBuilt in utilities like calendar, alarms, MP3 playerUses optional micro sdhc memory card (I use 16gb)Features like ringtones and wallpaper highly customizableNo problem using USB cable to connect it to PC.  Files can be easily manipulated using Windows or KIES (including pictures and videos)Cons:No external display (which probably helps with the battery life)User guide is a cruel joke, and nearly all online searches point back to itTime of day has to be set manuallyKeypad is adequate but there are others I like betterNote that I love this phone 5 stars worth in spite of the cons.  The Consumer Cellular SIM card popped in and went right to work, although it did take some doing to set up the internet access (because this is an unlocked AT&T; phone and not a native Consumer Cellular phone some advanced settings deep in the menus were needed).  I mainly use it to talk and text and replace my wrist watch.  I'm not a heavy user, but I carry it all the time on standby, and need to charge it much less than once a week.All in all, this is a nearly perfect compromise between basic flip phone and smart phone.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Lafitte1212
Reviews.Content: Great flip phone for you that do not need or want a smart phone. EZ to learn about it's  operation.

Reviews.Title: love
Reviews.Author: wenny
Reviews.Content: my uncle love it,  he said he can watch the keyboard clearly and easy to tied ,it is a good one

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Old Generation
Reviews.Author: Yong C.
Reviews.Content: I brought this for my mom. She only needs for calling and answering the phone. It come with charger and manual, no headset. But You can buy from outside store, so it's not a big deal. My mom loves it.Here is T-mobile in NY.

Reviews.Title: In Limbo, 5 stars are for dealer effort and an as advertised product
Reviews.Author: Gary D. Louton
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a backup for an old Moto V3, knowing how it's almost impossible these days to find a non-"smart" phone.The phone arrived PROMPTLY, packaged as "new" and as advertised.  I did test it with an existing sim card, and itworked fine.  I have every expectation that it will perform well, but until I finally actually need it and use it, I can'tattest that to be fact.

Reviews.Title: Nice Phone
Reviews.Author: Gregg
Reviews.Content: The Big screen, the large numbers, it is a good size to hold in your hand, works great, very simple to use. free shipping

Reviews.Title: Quality simple dumb phone
Reviews.Author: Jukester
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my grandma who just need a simple phone to use, not thing fancy. She loves it cause the bottom are large enough and the screen is big.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: Alvaro Guerrero
Reviews.Content: great product, great package, excellent price for the product, looks great, and perfect funtionality. perfect at all, buy it .

Reviews.Title: samsung quad band cell phone
Reviews.Author: Evan Lobo
Reviews.Content: i ordered this cell phone and it has been really great and easy to use for me- will recommend  to any one as it is very sturdy having suffered a few  falls in teh last few weeks

Reviews.Title: Simple
Reviews.Author: JMX "JMX"
Reviews.Content: This is a good simple, easy to view phone.  Mom is up in years and needs to be able to see numbers and keep it simple.  The newer phones are too complicated.  Plus, when she travels to Europe, she can take it.

Reviews.Title: Chineses language
Reviews.Author: XIN LI
Reviews.Content: Is there chinese language?who can help me?thank you! I need Chinese language , I don't know English ?so who can help me tell me .

Reviews.Title: Great Basic phone
Reviews.Author: MikeEr
Reviews.Content: Great basic phone, even has some not so basic features, like MP3 (can be used as a ringtone as well), Camera, Bluetooth, etc.

Reviews.Title: No fuzz, the logical choice.
Reviews.Author: Rene Lebel "Le Papa Éducateur"
Reviews.Content: I did not want to spent too much on a phone and my daughter didn't want something complex.  That's it.It is working fine.

Reviews.Title: no charger and no headset!
Reviews.Author: CC
Reviews.Content: That phone doesn't come with the headset or charger!!  Is it brand new product??I buy a pink one from the other, it got everything in the box.

ProductInfo.Features:
3.5mm Audio Jack; 2.4-Inch TFT LCD display Screen, 256K colors and MicroSD Card, up to 16 GB; Java MIDP 2.0; Browser WAP 2.0/xHTML; 28MB Internal Memory; 2.0 High Speed USB; Bluetooth v2.1 with A2DP;
1.3MP Camera with Autofocus and Smile Detection; MP3 and MP4 Player; FM Radio; Social Networking Applications; SMS, MMS, Email, Push Email and IM and Instant Messaging with Windows Live Messenger, Yahoo, G-talk, FB Chat and Samsung Messenger (MR).
Unlocked Quad-Band GSM Cell Phone compatible with 850/900/1800/1900 MHz frequencies and GPRS/EDGE data capabilities.
This unlocked cell phone will work on GSM carries like AT&T; and T-Mobile. Not all carrier features may be supported.
Talk time up to 9 hr. 10 min - Standby up to 610 hours.
ProductInfo.Name: Samsung GT-C3520 Unlocked Quad-Band GSM Phone with 1.3 MP Camera, MP3 Player, Social Networking and Bluetooth  -Silver
